document.title: West Virginia College- and Career-Ready Standards for English Language Arts

5A57DC2BD2844D639C179CC41EDFF90F.description: Discuss the importance of free and open access to information for everyone as well as situations or conditions where information is controlled or limited.

BAB872F99AEC4AA9860B30D2B8F770F7.description: With support and as grade appropriate, demonstrate understanding of copyright and acceptable use.

9D4B19771B6046DD8037D6AC5A10B0D4.description: Respectfully acknowledge ownership of work created by self and others (e.g., differentiating between copying and retelling in their own words}.

A6BEA710E84E4136BD3420DCA0AE5C2F.description: Demonstrate good library citizenship including rules of behavior and proper use and treatment of print materials and electronic resources.

071A659456D64E8BB677FE2B06B24BFE.description: Seek information from diverse sources, contexts, disciplines and cultures to increase understanding of topics and themes.

8B9FAB115A6B4E13ABFAAB14586CA4B0.description: With support, craft and deliver constructive feedback to help others make adjustments or improvements on a selection, product, or approach.

ACE606A6061043809712506077ADAFE8.description: Act on the feedback of others, solicited and unsolicited, to make adjustments or improvements on a selection, product, or approach.

3E716DCD08B54DAEBCE1855143722F2F.description: Explore the information available in and purposes for using a variety of print, non-print, and digital resources.

D4901DF14E64458B86F0D9254EA9E35A.description: Answer adult-directed and self-generated questions using print, non-print, and digital resources.

C3B530C61161498DB33418A616D733D4.description: Select works from a variety of genres and formats for enjoyment or to seek information.

62AA52E8ECF34650868E357223569207.description: Explore authors and/or topics of personal interest using library resources, including print, non-print, and digital to encourage the growth of life-long independent reading.

B89BEBCC9A25495F901DD016A5EFF839.description: Explore the role of the school/public library and librarians as community resources for free and open access to information.

6032B26E0B3C4BB5AFE0F3FF8C1CA15E.description: With guidance, explore online resources using a variety of databases or an online public access catalog, to find materials and information on topics of personal and academic interest.

4D57110C52EF4321A8ADE377426CB468.description: Demonstrate understanding of the process of selecting, checking out, and returning library materials.

AEF8CDB82DB0447BB6BBD6645944F372.description: With support, apply number sense and knowledge of alphabetical order to locate books and other resources in the library moving toward independence by the end of grade 2.

0C9984A44ECF4875AB4505B70787E141.description: Acquire and accurately use grade-appropriate library and book terms.

743324DBE766478495B9AB22C0C26D91.description: College- and Career-Readiness Standards for Library Media

7840A07A19704B0582DE4A1CBEFDBC93.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading, being read to, and responding to texts.

E4F59C574E77488580E8AE2E6958368A.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action by acting out the meanings.

5F18B3CD77BE475A8245E5E0A01AAE92.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use.

202ECC6A841241E091755152D61EE46B.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites.

53CAAC00F76C44CF98DE07D83D0F8702.description: Sort common objects into categories to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

4E8A6CB92C9E46D2B94B27A1A5E659F9.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

D49295183BCA4AC295F7116042A469A6.description: Introduce the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

2988B81005924A96A55AE86469594CBE.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately.

289321E76C364788A17F8C18E5C800E2.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

BA3A8F6CC5404C6191AA747540904EBF.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization , punctuation, and spelling when writing.
  • Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.
  • Recognize and name end punctuation.
  • Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds.
  • Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

6C25C3314B134689AD889F602939086E.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
  • Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.
  • Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/.
  • Understand and use question words.
  • Use the most frequently occurring prepositions.
  • Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

43C5DE06D75B4B359A48FA45782A6E93.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

520E7E86F7494A9998EDFB1A6726291E.description: Add drawings or other visuals to descriptions as desired to provide additional details.

4D9C1BB701694AD6B9F976C1CFB18960.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional details.

39DEA2265A0A40269C23E5C707C369B4.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

7E88EF86981944AD93382FDFD5622DAA.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

2C6119031EEF48D48D4BDC58828B4B61.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

526DD705B63C43C6B203985C4D20FE03.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

3413B98EF0BF4A9993134715E4B6376A.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

B5841983757C41EBA97A5138C814F13A.description: With guidance and support, participate in shared research and writing.

2BD16154FE324402B9C7793028874499.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

03C5C230620941D6A0A27F829FC86EF5.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of age-appropriate technologies to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

73F0A8C4F9A0404FB76A937EC4EB6787.description: With guidance and support from adults and collaborative discussions, add details to strengthen writing as needed.

C2D41819584147188BCFD9AC97049BC0.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

32791DBBE66049A9B54664EFC28B5D34.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/ explanatory texts; name and supply some information about the topic.

C7F15BED7B0A4538B0BD3781CDE12802.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which the topic or the name of the text being discussed is included; state an opinion or preference about the topic or book.

EAD985832F3347CB9007A8B73D6E53E9.description: Actively engage in group reading activities of grade-appropriate complex informational texts with purpose and understanding.

69E04189A1DC418692236B25906BDABE.description: Actively engage in group reading activities of grade-appropriate complex literary texts with purpose and understanding.

153493517E9145CEB283F935B5DB3DBF.description: Range of Reading and Text Complexity

920CEDCB0BBC478EA9DEBE01FF6BF683.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two literary or informational texts on the same topic.

2F58423F92C64DFCB680D0EAC466EC7A.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a literary or informational text.

66BE4CAF5D934D818D340DBA1D16E548.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the informational text in which they appear.

936CF563989044158032A5A85334AAA7.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar literary stories.

CAEBFFA3E5BB4AECA335E7062F181668.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the literary story in which they appear.

0B888BCCA9B640C1ADD78EAE57FB12D1.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in an informational text.

01F14A16FB5E483DA49F7FB86F61EFF7.description: With prompting and support, identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

254434365C3C430E949884481BAF08E3.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in an informational text.

83F30B6D744B425BB4B442C72ECDD6DB.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story in a literary text.

23D9238E62F64675AD037B7046E2DAD3.description: With prompting and support, recognize common types of texts.

26FB2D3275AE4BFB9A399E02AD389E0F.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a literary text.

43E219587F114796AE685936DABA600D.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in an informational text.

8B02EBF233164F99B1E4FBC324348F5C.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of an informational text.

74A52BF9ED294F5FAAA3B8D74AECCBE5.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in an informational text.

CB3E8D3732D645A2AFA1C68B88EFA938.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a literary text.

AD0565D7840C4E3A96135F9705BBBC23.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details in literary texts.

55072541E33944C99F17D8DACE1641B5.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a literary text.

287FED2351884EBA9DCDCB583FB15711.description: Recognize and name upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

E73FE46FCFC64F1C8754B1F13D166AAC.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

F8A8129924EA4C2EAABBCCD1A27CAB9B.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

BFC51A50AE3844A0A1C2E13A2BE3B70B.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

F3E06233275E48CB89584AB03A0995AC.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

0843857B97964FADB61F1184F184DCD8.description: Add or substitute individual sounds in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

C970FC4D7BDB4283A0306EF69B01B47F.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds in three-phoneme words (i.e., consonant-vowel-consonant, hereinafter CVC). This does not include CVCs ending with /1/, /r/ or /x/.

0EDC0E12BE8A4DABBD51EA1807A78018.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

B25C56E1C3C14541974DE14F4748F319.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

89CD609D907B46C9A1138A0EDB0ADD99.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

9B733B90861A4267886443ADAB822332.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

4F689F235ECC4C918DE0363D6DC8E666.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight.

FC7B953BB85C452F9F5534A747F4C17A.description: Associate common spellings with the five major short vowel sounds.

A0DBFB09EABF456AA6026C7901C5B23D.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

2181301B008548FEA9AD026DB75C2274.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

6619B89DE66648DE838BD23F73B61C53.description: Read emergent- and beginner- reader texts with purpose and understanding.
